content:
Diagnosis:		Prostate adenocarcinoma with ductal features, T3aN1M0

Management:		Enrolled in STAMPEDE trial Arm K, March 2024
		Commenced ADT + docetaxel 15 Mar 2024
		Completed 4 cycles docetaxel

Histology:		Gleason 4+4=8, ISUP Grade 4
		Pelvic nodal involvement on staging

Current situation:	Pre cycle 5 docetaxel review

[redacted name] attended for trial assessment today. PSA has shown excellent response, dropping from 34.2 to 2.1. Testosterone remains suppressed at <0.3. He has experienced grade 2 peripheral neuropathy affecting his feet, requiring dose reduction to 60mg/m2 from cycle 4. Other toxicities include grade 1 fatigue and occasional hot flushes from ADT. Performance status remains 1. Trial-mandated QoL questionnaires completed today show stable scores. Blood results are acceptable for proceeding with cycle 5 docetaxel. Trial-specific bone density scan completed yesterday shows T-score -1.2 at hip. Plan to proceed with cycle 5 today at reduced dose. Will arrange trial-mandated CT assessment after cycle 6. Next review in 3 weeks with trial team.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: adenocarcinoma with ductal features, Gleason 4+4=8, ISUP Grade 4

cancer_timeline.value: Started ADT and docetaxel on STAMPEDE trial Arm K
Docetaxel dose reduced to 60mg/m2 from cycle 4 due to grade 2 peripheral neuropathy
PSA response from 34.2 to 2.1, testosterone suppressed <0.3
Trial-mandated bone density scan shows T-score -1.2 at hip

status_updates.value: Prostate cancer showing good biochemical response to ADT and docetaxel on STAMPEDE trial. Treatment complicated by peripheral neuropathy requiring dose reduction
Good PSA response from 34.2 to 2.1 with testosterone suppression
Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy affecting feet requiring dose reduction
Proceeding with cycle 5 docetaxel at reduced dose of 60mg/m2
Review in 3 weeks with trial team
